rule-5-34-a.test_description: Building area type = "school (primary)"; building includes a conditioned zone that has two exterior walls with windows. Baseline fenestration area is  established correctly.

standard.ruleset_reference:
Table G3.1#5 baselnid column e. e. Skylights and Glazed Smoke Vents. Skylight area shall be
equal to that in the proposed design or 3%, whichever is smaller.
standard.rule_description: If skylight area in the proposed desing is 3% or less of the roof surface, the skylight area shall be equal to that in the proposed design.
standard.rule_dependency: None

rule-5-34-b.test_description: Building area type = "school (primary)"; building includes a conditioned zone that has two exterior walls with windows. Baseline fenestration area is  established correctly.

standard.ruleset_reference:
Table G3.1#5 baselnid column e. e. Skylights and Glazed Smoke Vents. Skylight area shall be
equal to that in the proposed design or 3%, whichever is smaller.
standard.rule_description: If skylight area in the proposed desing is 3% or less of the roof surface, the skylight area shall be equal to that in the proposed design.
standard.rule_dependency: None

rule-5-35-a.test_description: Building includes a conditioned zone that has two roof surfaces one of which has skylights. Skylight area in the proposed design exceeds 3% of total roof area. Baseline skylight area is correctly modeled as equal to 3% of the total roof area

standard.ruleset_reference:
Table G3.1#5 baselnid column e: If the skylight area of the proposed design is greater than 3%, baseline skylight area shall be decreased by an
identical percentage in all roof components in which skylights are located to reach 3%.
standard.rule_description: If the skylight area of the proposed design is greater than 3%, baseline skylight area shall be decreased by an identical percentage in all roof components in which skylights are located to reach 3%.
standard.rule_dependency: None

rule-5-35-b.test_description: Building includes a conditioned zone that has two roof surfaces both of which have skylights. Skylight area in the user model exceeds 3% of total roof area. Baseline skylight area is not modeled as equal to 3% of the total roof area, which is incorrect

standard.ruleset_reference:
Table G3.1#5 baselnid column e: If the skylight area of the proposed design is greater than 3%, baseline skylight area shall be decreased by an
identical percentage in all roof components in which skylights are located to reach 3%.
standard.rule_description: If the skylight area of the proposed design is greater than 3%, baseline skylight area shall be decreased by an identical percentage in all roof components in which skylights are located to reach 3%.
standard.rule_dependency: None

rule-5-36-a.test_description: Building includes a conditioned zone that has two roof surfaces both of which have skylights. Baseline skylight area is allocated to roof surfaces in the same proportion as in the proposed design

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1#5 baselnid column e: Skylight orientation and tilt shall be the same as in the proposed design.
standard.rule_description: Skylight area must be allocated to surfaces in the same proportion in the baseline as in the proposed design; Skylight orientation and tilt shall be the same as in the proposed design.
standard.rule_dependency: None

rule-5-36-b.test_description: Building includes a conditioned zone that has two roof surfaces both of which have skylights. Baseline skylight area is allocated to roof surfaces in the same proportion as in the proposed design

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1#5 baselnid column e: Skylight orientation and tilt shall be the same as in the proposed design.
standard.rule_description: Skylight area must be allocated to surfaces in the same proportion in the baseline as in the proposed design; Skylight orientation and tilt shall be the same as in the proposed design.
standard.rule_dependency: None

rule-5-37-a.test_description: Building is located in climate zone 4A. It includes a semiheated zone based on heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that servies it. Skylight area in the building is 0%-2.0%. The baseline skylight U-factor is established correctly.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1#5 baseline column e: Skylight U-factor … shall match the appropriate requirements in Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8 using the value and the applicable skylight percentage.
standard.rule_description: Skylight U-factors for residential, non-residential and semiheated spaces in the baseline model must match the appropriate requirements in Table G3.4-1 through G3.4-8
standard.rule_dependency:
1. Baseline heating and cooling capacities are established correctly (air-side HVAC rule TBD). This affects baseline space conditioning categories
2. Baseline skylight area is established correctly (Rules 34,35)

rule-5-38-a.test_description: Building is located in climate zone 4A. It includes a zone with residential occupancy type that is conditioned based on heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that servies it. Skylight area in the building is 0%-2.0%. The baseline skylight SHGC is established correctly.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1#5 baseline column e: Skylight… SHGC properties shall match the appropriate requirements in Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8 using the value and the applicable skylight percentage.
standard.rule_description: Skylight SHGC properties shall match the appropriate requirements in Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8 using the value and the applicable skylight percentage.
standard.rule_dependency:
1. Baseline heating and cooling capacities are established correctly (air-side HVAC rule TBD). This affects baseline space conditioning categories
2. Baseline skylight area is established correctly (Rules 34,35)

rule-5-38-b.test_description: Building is located in climate zone 4A. It includes a zone with residential occupancy type that is conditioned based on heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that servies it. Skylight area in the building is 0%-2.0%. The baseline skylight SHGC is not established correctly.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1#5 baseline column e: Skylight… SHGC properties shall match the appropriate requirements in Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8 using the value and the applicable skylight percentage.

The baseline vertical fenestration SHGC for the space is established correctly.

The baseline vertical fenestration SHGC for the space is established correctly.

rule-5-39-a.test_description: subsurface has manual dynamic glazing in both user model and proposed model; manual check is required to verify that SHCG and VT were modeled correctly

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #5 Proposed column a5: Automatically controlled dynamic glazing may be modeled. Manually controlled dynamic glazing shall use the average of the minimum and maximum SHGC and VT.
standard.rule_description: Automatically controlled dynamic glazing may be modeled. Manually controlled dynamic glazing shall use the average of the minimum and maximum SHGC and VT.
standard.rule_dependency: None

rule-5-39-b.test_description: subsurface has automatic dynalic glazing in both user model and proposed model

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #5 Proposed column a5: Automatically controlled dynamic glazing may be modeled. Manually controlled dynamic glazing shall use the average of the minimum and maximum SHGC and VT.
standard.rule_description: Automatically controlled dynamic glazing may be modeled. Manually controlled dynamic glazing shall use the average of the minimum and maximum SHGC and VT.
standard.rule_dependency: None

rule-5-39-c.test_description: subsurface has diferent type of dynamic glazing in the proposed design vs user model
